page.title: 17DAIRY FARMING CONT
page.content: DAIRY FARMING - (CONTD FROM PAGE 16) The working day on a dairy farm generally begins at about 5.15 a.m. The first job of the day is to bring the cows into the milking parlour for milking. The time needed for milking depends upon the size of the herd and the capacity of the milking machines. The milk is stored in large metal containers where it is allowed to cool until the milk lorry comes to take it to the dairy. As soon as milking is over the parlour is cleaned out and then it is time for breakfast at about 8.30 a.m. The rest of the day is spent doing routine work around the farm, until about 3.00 p.m. when the cows need to be milked again. Neither farm delivered milk to local customers, that was left to the milkmen. The price of milk is governed by the European Economic Community.
